intro: Cryptantha collina, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as slopes and meadows. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are clustered in loose racemes. Cryptantha collina is often found in the Sierra Nevada and other mountainous regions.
